top_categories.workout_context: Big Sky Gravel’s montana mountains, local event demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Big Sky Gravel rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Big Sky Gravel when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Racing Big Sky Gravel isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Big Sky Gravel. Make this intensity feel like home.
Big Sky Gravel’s montana mountain gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Big Sky Gravel’s 5,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Big Sky Gravel — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Big Sky Gravel’s montana mountain gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Every session at Big Sky Gravel intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Big Sky Gravel’s 5,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Big Sky Gravel — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Big Sky Gravel’s 70 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Big Sky Gravel. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Big Sky Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on montana mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: montana mountains, local event, mountain west gravel.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and Over Under to prepare you for 70 miles of montana mountain gravel in Red Lodge, Montana.
